intro: Eriosema chrysadenium var. bequaertii, commonly known as the golden flame eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features delicate, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
